overview_of_class: This course introduces graduate students in history and adjunct disciplines (they are encouraged to take this class) to major themes in modern US history and its historiography. It selectively examines established scholarship, recent work seen as on the cutting edge, and challenges of practice in the discipline. It also helps prepare students for exams and teaching, and for those specializing in the 20th century, to identify topics they may wish to research further.
name: General Field Seminar in American History
subject: HISTORY
